# Poor man's Localization Tool

Simple parser for csv file with format:

| android_id | ios_id | en    | fr      |
|------------|--------|-------|---------|
| str_id_0   | strId0 | Hello | Bonjour |
| str_id_1   | strId1 | World | Monde   |

## Usage
* Make sure you have python installed

`$ python lokalize.py <path to csv file>`

The output will be:
* android/values/strings.xml
* android/values-fr/strings.xml
* ios/en.lproj/Localizable.strings
* ios/fr.lproj/Localizable.strings

strings.xml
```Xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<resources>
    <!--Auto-generated by Poor Man's Localization-->
    <string name="app_id" translatable="false">com.telus.myaccount</string>
    <string name="app_name">My App</string>
    <string name="login_title">Login</string>
    <string name="login_error_dialog_title">Error</string>
    <string name="login_oauth_error">Sorry, there was an error logging you in. Please try again later.</string>
    <string name="login_hide_details">Hide details</string>
    <string name="login_show_details">Show details</string>
    <string name="android_specific_string">Android only</string>
</resources>
```
Localizable.strings
```Strings
"name" = "com.telus.myaccount"
"app_name" = "My App"
"login_title" = "Login"
"login_failed_unlinked_account_dialog_title" = "Error"
"login_oauth_error" = "Sorry, there was an error logging you in. Please try again later."
"hide_details" = "Hide details"
"show_details" = "Show details"
"ios_specific_string" = "iOS only"

```
